poem:
Title: In the Bosom of Apathy

Lost sheep, adrift,
in the muted silence of government ink.
Letter-edged souls, in limbo,
bouncing on Home Office's cold ambivalence.

38% they say, faces claimed by alien numbers.
Rwanda's children, do you tally your own absence?
The rest – swallowed by shadows.
Only 2,145, they say, "continue".

The indifferent algorithm churns,
a trail of muted prayer – where is humanity's echo?
